normalized_poster.payload_xml: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?> <treasuredBiomesPoster continent="Europe"> <title>Europe: Ancient Forests, Fjords, and Living Shores</title> <biomes> <biome> <name>Svalbard Arctic Tundra</name> <image url="https://www.pexels.com/photo/polar-bear-on-ice-219563/" /> <description>Svalbard’s tundra is a brief summer world of moss, flowers, and melting ice. Reindeer graze on green patches while glaciers and sea ice shape the coast of this high Arctic island chain.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Macaronesian Laurel Forests</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/twisted-laurel-trees-silhouettes-thick-fog-2693093077" /> <description>Macaronesian laurel forests cloak Atlantic islands in cool mist. These evergreen woods are ancient in feel, with mossy trees, wet air, and many species that survive in mild ocean climates.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Białowieża Forest</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/wilderness-forest-one-last-largest-remaining-2654125531" /> <description>Białowieża Forest is one of Europe’s last great lowland old‑growth forests. Ancient oaks and mixed woods provide habitat for bison, wolves, and woodpeckers in a living time capsule.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Norwegian Fjords</name> <image url="https://www.pexels.com/photo/waterfalls-near-body-of-water-4379013/" /> <description>Norway’s fjords are deep sea inlets carved by glaciers. Steep cliffs, waterfalls, and quiet villages line these blue corridors where mountains drop straight into the ocean.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Plitvice Lakes</name> <image url="https://www.pexels.com/photo/waterfalls-in-plitvice-lakes-240040/" /> <description>Plitvice Lakes are a chain of clear pools and waterfalls. Mineral-rich water builds natural dams, creating terraces of turquoise lakes linked by cascades through forest.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Wadden Sea</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/aerial-view-wadden-sea-intertidal-zone-1290353899" /> <description>The Wadden Sea is a vast tidal flat along the North Sea coast. Twice a day, the water pulls back to reveal mud and sand where millions of migrating birds refuel.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Camargue Wetlands</name> <image url="https://www.pexels.com/photo/flamingos-in-the-middle-of-a-lake-6074934/" /> <description>The Camargue is a marshy river delta in southern France. Lagoons, reeds, and salt flats support flamingos, wild horses, and a mix of fresh and salty waters shaped by tides and floods.</description> </biome> </biomes> </treasuredBiomesPoster>
